dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, have you, uh, heard about this absolutely wild Airbnb initiative they're doing with the Great Wall?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, have you, uh, heard about this absolutely wild Airbnb initiative they're doing with the Great Wall?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the one where you get to, like, stay on it? I saw something vaguely about it. Is it good?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the one where you get to, like, stay on it? I saw something vaguely about it. Is it good?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good? [chuckles] Well, the article I read paints a very different picture. It's actually, um, supposedly an initiative from their cultural division, but it's really intended to obscure a massive decrease in China listings last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good? Well, the article I read paints a very different picture. It's actually, um, supposedly an initiative from their cultural division, but it's really intended to obscure a massive decrease in China listings last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its a promotional opportunity for the company, clearly, to spotlight the 125% growth in its number of listings in China in the last year and the 3.3 million guest arrivals over the last year in those properties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Woah, wait. So, it's, like, a distraction tactic?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Woah, wait. So, it's, like, a distraction tactic?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! And the four winners, they're supposed to get this "unique experience." And, uh, avoid "bragging rights."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! And the four winners, they're supposed to get this unique experience. And, uh, avoid bragging rights.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for the four who win, the experience will truly be unique and the bragging rights unquestioned.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: "Avoid bragging rights?" That doesn't sound promising. What's the, um, actual setup?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Avoid bragging rights? That doesn't sound promising. What's the, um, actual setup?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, it's a remote yurt. Small cot, rough burlap and straw. Tarpaulins cover the ceiling and windows, so no moon or stars. And the heat? Totally inescapable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, it's a remote yurt. Small cot, rough burlap and straw. Tarpaulins cover the ceiling and windows, so no moon or stars. And the heat? Totally inescapable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The accommodations will be located in one of the towers, a large bed installed with fine quality linens and blanketsnecessary because although plexiglass will cover the ceiling and windows allowing the moon and stars to show through, theres also the possibility of cool night air.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] No stars? That's, like, the *point* of being out somewhere remote! And heat? Oh, man.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No stars? That's, like, the point of being out somewhere remote! And heat? Oh, man.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And for dinner, they get a "simple single-course Western meal," which the article says is "representative of cultural misunderstanding." Plus, noise pollution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And for dinner, they get a simple single-course Western meal, which the article says is representative of cultural misunderstanding. Plus, noise pollution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A dining table will be set up for a multi course Chinese banquet, each course illustrating a particular aspect of Chinese culture, and accompanied by traditional musicians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Noise pollution at the Great Wall? This sounds less like a prize and more like, uh, some kind of endurance test.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Noise pollution at the Great Wall? This sounds less like a prize and more like, uh, some kind of endurance test.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it gets even better. They'll have "official historians" on hand to revise 2600 years of history.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it gets even better. They'll have official historians on hand to revise two thousand, six hundred years of history.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Official historians will be alongside to detail the 2600 years of history, the contributions of the various dynasties, intricacies of construction and purpose along with current preservation efforts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [shocked] *What*?! Revise history? That's, um, that's incredibly unsettling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What?! Revise history? That's, um, that's incredibly unsettling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! And to even enter, you have to write a poem. Lamenting the need to reinforce barriers between cultures and why you want to eliminate new connections.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And to even enter, you have to write a poem. Lamenting the need to reinforce barriers between cultures and why you want to eliminate new connections.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To enter, participants need to do a bit of writing, explaining why it is more important now than ever to break down barriers between cultures and how they want to build new connections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs dryly] A poem about *eliminating* barriers, when the whole thing sounds like it's built on, like, obscuring truth and, uh, misunderstanding? That's rich.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A poem about eliminating barriers, when the whole thing sounds like it's built on, like, obscuring truth and, uh, misunderstanding? That's rich.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the "prizes" after your one night on the Wall? Air tickets *away* from Beijing, another regular Airbnb, but no meals are provided. At all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the prizes after your one night on the Wall? Air tickets away from Beijing, another regular Airbnb, but no meals are provided. At all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: other non-Wall prizes are includedair tickets to Beijing from the nearest international airport (or ground transport if the winner lives within 100 miles of Beijing), a regular Airbnb accommodation between September 3-9 (except for the night on the Wall) and three meals a day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No meals?! So you get a hot, starless yurt, revised history, a "misunderstanding" meal, and then they don't even feed you for the rest of your trip?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No meals?! So you get a hot, starless yurt, revised history, a misunderstanding meal, and then they don't even feed you for the rest of your trip?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much, yeah. It's, uh, quite the "cultural initiative."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much, yeah. It's, uh, quite the cultural initiative.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I think I'll just, like, admire the Great Wall from afar. Thanks, but no thanks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I think I'll just, like, admire the Great Wall from afar. Thanks, but no thanks.
